params.counter: Additional amount of Ping-Pong rounds to conclude
params.destination_: Chain to send Ping message to

receiveBaseMessage(uint32,uint32,bytes32.details: Message recipient needs to ensure that merkle proof for the message is at least as old as the optimistic period that the recipient is using. Note: as this point it is checked that the "message optimistic period" has passed, however the period value itself could be anything, and thus could differ from the one that the recipient would like to enforce.

params.nonce: Message nonce on the origin domain
params.proofMaturity: Message's merkle proof age in seconds

destination().notice: Local chain Destination: used for receiving messages

doPing(uint32,address,uint16).notice: Send a Ping message to destination chain. Upon receiving a Ping, a Pong message will be sent back. If `counter > 0`, this process will be repeated when the Pong message is received.

origin().notice: Local chain Origin: used for sending messages

pingsReceived().notice: Amount of "Ping" messages received. Every received Ping message leads to sending a Pong message back to initial sender.

pongsReceived().notice: Amount of "Pong" messages received. When all messages are delivered, should be equal to `pingsSent`

receiveBaseMessage(uint32,uint32,bytes32.notice: Message recipient needs to implement this function in order to receive cross-chain messages.

documentation.text:
@notice Amount of "Ping" messages received.
 Every received Ping message leads to sending a Pong message back to initial sender.

@notice Amount of "Pong" messages received.
 When all messages are delivered, should be equal to `pingsSent`

@notice Emitted when a Ping message is sent.
 Triggered externally, or by receveing a Pong message with instructions to do more pings.

@notice Emitted when a Ping message is received.
 Will always send a Pong message back.

@notice Emitted when a Pong message is sent.
 Triggered whenever a Ping message is received.

@notice Emitted when a Pong message is received.
 Will initiate a new Ping, if the counter in the message is non-zero.
@dev Returns a random optimistic period value from 0 to 59 seconds.
